intro: Eriogonum wasatchense, commonly known as the Wasatch buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and is often found in regions with limited precipitation. Eriogonum wasatchense plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native environment.
